description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dikff","text":"This is the protocol used in our Laboratory at the University of Liverpool to electroporate molecules into Bodo saltans.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working for electroporation of various molecules into Bodo.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7htqp","text":"Antisense peptide nucleic acids (PNAs, synthetised by Panagene, South Korea) were electroporated into Bodo slatans cells using Neon® Transfection System MPK1025 (Invitrogen).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":102,"length":12},{"style":"sup","offset":131,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jssf","text":"Bodo saltans was cultured in a cerophyl-based medium enriched with 3.5 mM sodium phosphate dibasic (Na2HPO4)1. Cultures were incubated at 22 °C in T25 tissue culture flasks containing 20 ml of media bacterized with Klebsiella pneumoniae subsp. Pneumoniae (ATCC® 700831). 3 to 4 day old cultures were used for electroporation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":215,"length":39},{"style":"sub","offset":102,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":106,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ms3p","text":"The steps below describe how to prepare Bodo cells for electroporation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":40,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"987dl","text":"1-Filter the culture through 100 and 8 µm filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de26","text":"2-Harvest the cells by centrifugation at 1200 × g for 12 mins at 19 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b819d","text":"3-Wash the cells with 10 ml PBS and centrifuge as above. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsecr","text":"4-Re-suspend the cells in 5 ml PBS, count the cells using hemocytometer and take the volume of cells which contains 5×10^5 cells, as recommended for Neon transfection kit for 10 µl tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f3b04","text":"5-Centrifuge at 1200 × g for 12 mins at 19 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5g2r0","text":"6-Remove the PBS and resuspend the cells in resuspension buffer for electroporation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"esrpl","text":"7-Add the antisense molecule at the final concentration of 50 µM to the Bodo cells and mix well by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":72,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hvs7","text":"8-Aspirate the mix into Neon pipette and electroporate using 1800 V, 10 ms pulse width and 1 pulse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp03q","text":"The steps below describe how to prepare electroporated Bodo cells for imaging. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":55,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eadkk","text":"1-Empty the pipette of Neon system in a well of a 96-well plate after electroporation, add 5 µl of PBS, mix, add 15 µl of warm low melting temperature agarose (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and mix with the cells. Let is set for a few seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fc7sa","text":"2-Add 200 µl of Hochest 33342 (Thermo Fisher Scientific)diluted 1:2000 in PBSto the agarose-embedded Bodo and incubate 10 mins at room temperature (RT).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":101,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"et0rn","text":"3-Wash the agarose with PBS (2×5mins) at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9in9","text":"4-Remove the agarose from the well with clean forceps and place it on a microscope slide. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3v0r8","text":"5-Add a drop of a mounting medium (eg. Vectashield, Vector Laboratories), and flatten the agarose as much as you can using the coverslip. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6hm18","text":"6-Proceed with either fluorescence or confocal imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar3st","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cnsos","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"880E3600CACA11ECBD39A1A37ECAB298","height":200,"id":235908,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":32,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":145,"style":"italic"},{"length":5,"offset":189,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fkghp","text":"Figure 1. Confocal image of liveBodo cell electroporated with antisense peptide nucleic acid (PNA). A) TAMRA-labelled antisense molecules inside Bodo cell. B) DNA of bacterial cells inside Bodo stained with Hoechst 33342.C) Overlay of two channels.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"PNAS in bodo.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgngbihbp.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgnebihbp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgnfbihbp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgndbihbp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qnad","text":"Gomaa Fatma, Li ZuHong, Docampo Roberto, Girguis Peter, E. V. Bodo saltans culture protocol V.2. Protocols.io (2018). doi:10.17504/protocols.io.sh6eb9e","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Electroporation of fluorescent antisense molecules into Bodo saltans and live imaging
title_html: Electroporation of fluorescent antisense molecules into Bodo saltans and live imaging
